page.title: 12Old Timbersbrook
page.content:
The morning sun has lifted o'er the hill In Timbersbrook The horses at the trough have sipped their fill In Timbersbrook The cattle in the meadow are a'lowing While in the fields the men they are a'mowing, But best of all the cocks they are a' crowing In Timbersbrook. The white of morning sky is touched with blue In Timbersbrook The flowers in the hedgerows drenched with dew In Timbersbrook Breezes round the stackyard are a'blowing and haycarts to the barn they are a'going But best of all the cocks they are a'crowing In Timbersbrook.
Frank Stockton
